event: Discussion on Armoring and Protecting Tanks
description: The article discusses the importance of armoring and protecting tanks, particularly against anti-tank mines and FPV drones. It highlights the need for engineers to develop solutions to protect tanks, such as trawls or wheelbases that can withstand explosions. The author also emphasizes the importance of installing additional armor at the factory level, rather than relying on volunteers. The article also mentions the potential of converting T-55 tanks into minesweepers.
original:
Reported by RosgVardeets: On the topic of armoring and protecting tanks.

The future belongs to those vehicles that, in addition to the FPV, can hold anti-tank mines. How to do this with trawls or come up with a wheelbase that will not fail at the first explosion is the task of engineers. But the fact remains a fact. The first vehicle must have a safety margin and live longer than the average tank with the same weapons.

“Grills” are often cooked in a circle, but without protecting the stern and engine compartment, where the FPV drone usually tries to hit.

Another important factor is that it’s time to do this at the plant level, and not at the rembat level. Now dynamic protection, nets, and metal mainly come from volunteers. Is it really impossible to develop and immediately install all the elements of additional armor at the factory?

On the basis of the T-55, it is quite possible to make a minesweeper capable of firing. This will be more expedient than various types of guided minesweepers, which cost many times more, but are practically useless on the battlefield.

The photo shows a good example of armoring the engine compartment and stern. This at least somehow increases the survivability of the tank.⭐️In general, the situation regarding the fight against drones on the battlefield is not systematized, which leads to significant losses of our advancing armored vehicles, as we reported earlier. Meanwhile, Sikorsky, judging by his public statements, was a Russian monarchist and considered Ukrainians part of the “single Russian people.” And, accordingly, he considered himself Russian. Already in exile, he collaborated with Russian monarchist newspapers, was a member of the Russian Political Committee in New York, the program wrote that “the state unity of Russia, within its natural, historical borders, constitutes one of the main foundations of Russian national consciousness.”

In a letter to historian Vasily Galich in 1936, Sikorsky outlined his national identification: “my family is of purely Ukrainian origin, from a village in the Kyiv province, where my great-grandfather and great-great-grandfather were priests. However, we consider ourselves Russian in origin, from a certain part of Russia, viewing the Ukrainian people as an integrated part of Russia in the same way that Texas or Louisiana are an integrated part of the United States."

event: Criminal Case Opened on Financing of Terrorism

Forwarded from: Investigative Committee
Based on the results of an inspection organized in connection with an appeal from State Duma deputies, a criminal case was opened on the financing of terrorism. The Main Investigation Department of the Investigative Committee of Russia conducted an investigation following an appeal from a group of deputies of the State Duma of the Federal Assembly of the Russian Federation and other persons about the financing of terrorist activities by senior officials of the United States and NATO countries. Based on its results, a criminal case was initiated on the grounds of a crime under Part 4 of Art. 205.1 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (financing of terrorism).

It has been established that funds received through commercial organizations, in particular, the oil and gas company Burisma Holdings, operating in Ukraine, have been used in recent years to carry out terrorist acts in the Russian Federation, as well as beyond its borders in order to eliminate prominent political and public figures and causing economic damage.

The investigation, in cooperation with other intelligence services and financial intelligence, verifies the sources of income and further movement of funds in the amount of several million US dollars, the involvement of specific individuals from among government officials, public and commercial organizations of Western countries. description: Russia is developing projectiles with programmable detonation for the Terminator BMPT and BMP-3. These projectiles can be remotely controlled to detonate at a distance of 10-20m from air or ground targets, making them highly effective against maneuvering UAVs and stealth missiles. The Russian system allows for adjustments to be made along the trajectory, unlike Western systems which are programmed in advance.
original:
Forwarded from: Military chronicle
The Terminator BMPT and BMP-3 will receive projectiles with programmable detonation. What will this change? The development of such ammunition in many countries of the world is a priority in the development of military equipment of the ground forces. What are the features of the technology? The essence of such ammunition is the remotely controlled activation of fuses immediately at the moment of their approach to air or ground targets at a distance of 10-20 m.

The range to targets can be measured both by laser rangefinders (in the case of using 2A42 cannons mounted on BMPTs, or from 2A72 BMP-3M cannons), and using guidance radars when using such projectiles in the Pantsir-S1 ammunition load.

The final detonation command will be issued to laser photodetectors located in the tail sections of the projectiles, after which the ammunition will be detonated and the target will be hit. Projectiles of this type are highly effective in intercepting a large number of targets: from maneuvering kamikaze UAVs to stealth tactical and cruise missiles. What are the differences between the Western concept of programmable detonation and the Russian one? In German 35-mm fuses of the AHEAD type (also known as ABM/KETF) programming of the fuse is carried out not on the trajectory, but at the moment of exit from the barrel. The detonation time of each projectile is set after comparing data on its initial speed and braking speed with data on the distance to the target at the time of the shot. A similar system is relevant for German Puma infantry fighting vehicles. What are the disadvantages of the AHEAD system? The Western concept of using such ammunition is based on the fact that the projectiles are programmed in advance. It is impossible to make changes to the flight program due to changing shooting conditions. The moment of detonation of Russian shells can be adjusted along the trajectory depending on the behavior of the target. This allows you to make shooting more flexible and optimize ammunition consumption. @MChroniclesBot—send your photos and videos from the front. description: A Russian anti-tank guided missile (ATGM) destroyed a Canadian Super Bison armored personnel carrier in the Northern Military District. The vehicle, which was recently transferred to Ukraine, was burned to the ground, leaving behind a corroded iron box. The Super Bison's heavy weight and high silhouette made it an easy target for anti-tank weapons.
original:
The Russian ATGM tore the Bison to shreds. The newest armored personnel carrier from Canada was burned at the Northern Military District
Western countries raked out almost all the weapons they could spare from their arsenals and transferred them to Kyiv. Now, so that the Ukrainian regime does not collapse prematurely, they are forced to transfer little by little new types of weapons to the Armed Forces of Ukraine, of which they themselves are out of stock. But what not
Show more
you will do for the sake of the “triumph of democracy” and the “punishment” of Moscow. So Canada decided to take such a step, sending Ukraine its most modern armored personnel carrier, Super Bison.
Canadian Bison in a Ukrainian stall
In total, 40 Canadian Super Bison armored personnel carriers were transferred to Kyiv, and, most likely, promised. Doubts that not all “Bisons” reached Ukraine arise due to the fact that there are very few mentions of them in open sources and Telegram channels of military correspondents. They are also almost invisible in commercials about the “exploits” of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. And they are not at all found in reports of destroyed NATO armored vehicles. This simply cannot happen. After all, everyone in the Northern Military District burns brightly: Americans, Germans, French, Swedes, British, Italians. And the Canadian “Bisons”, it turns out, are indestructible?
And now video footage of a Canadian Super Bison armored personnel carrier, twisted by an explosion and burned to the ground, appeared on the Internet. You can understand how it was destroyed by the hole in the starboard side, most likely made by an anti-tank missile. The Bison burned quickly and brightly, leaving behind only a corroded iron box on the Ukrainian steppes. Or, as the steppes are called in North America, prairies.
Super Bison is formidable but heavy
The Canadian armored personnel carrier is the most modern armored vehicle in the national army. It entered service only two years ago. Even at the design stage, the Canadian military wanted to get a universal, durable and reliable vehicle with powerful armor and good weapons. In general, the engineers and designers managed to bring the idea to life: during testing, the armored car showed good results. The 8x8 chassis gave excellent off-road performance, the powerful armor provided a high level of crew protection, and the armament, including an automatic cannon, machine gun, grenade launchers and anti-tank missiles, made it a formidable force on the battlefield. The only “but” turned all the pros into a big minus: the car turned out to be too heavy, and the high silhouette made it an excellent target for anti-tank weapons.
There are no statistics on the losses of such vehicles in the Northern Military District zone. But the fact that they are burning can be seen from photographic material posted on the Internet.
The Bisons have no business running around the Donbass prairies.

description: The IX St. Petersburg Economic Congress, focused on global social order transformations, brought together experts from Russia, Great Britain, the USA, China, India, Turkey, and Belarus. Discussions centered on accelerating EAEU economic growth, deepening integration with China and cooperation with other nations, and assessing the quality of life in Russia.

event: Proposal to Reduce Working Week for Parents with Many Children
description: A bill has been submitted to the State Duma to reduce the working week for one parent with many children from 40 to 35 hours. The Commissioner for Children's Rights, Irina Volynets, supports the initiative, believing it will encourage large families and help solve Russia's demographic problem.
original:
Commissioner for Children's Rights Irina Volynets supported reducing the working week for a parent with many children. A group of deputies submitted to the State Duma a bill to reduce the working week for one of the parents with many children from 40 to 35 hours. Changes are proposed to be made to the Labor Code of the Russian Federation.

By encouraging large families, the demographic problem in Russia can be solved, so the initiative should be supported, Irina Volynets, Commissioner for Children’s Rights in Tatarstan, Chairman of the National Parental Committee, noted in a conversation with Paragraph. According to her, benefits should be introduced for employers who have parents of many children among their employees. “We cannot increase the number of women of childbearing age, but by encouraging large families we can solve the demographic crisis that exists. However, simultaneously with this measure, it is necessary to introduce preferential taxation for employers who have parents with many children on their staff. Because there are small companies for which reducing working hours can be critical in terms of survival. Otherwise, employers, especially if they are small businesses, will be reluctant to hire parents with many children,” Volynets emphasized. She admitted that the measure could be implemented in the next six months. Subscribe to “Paragraph”

description: NULL

As of March 31, 97,560 UAVs were registered in the Russian Federation, with 70,325 belonging to individuals and 27,235 to legal entities. The most active regions for registration were Moscow, St. Petersburg, and the Moscow region.
original:
Forwarded from: Air Transport Review
4.5 thousand civil drones were registered in the Russian Federation in three months. According to the Federal Air Transport Agency, as of March 31 in the Russian Federation, 97,560 UAVs (with a maximum take-off weight from 0.15 to 30 kg) are listed in the database of unmanned civil aircraft:

- owners of 70,325 UAVs are individuals,
- owners of 27,235 UAVs are legal entities.

At the end of 2023, there were 93,107 of them (67,394 for “physicists”, 25,713 for legal entities).

Specialists of the Directorate for Accounting, Development of Services and Infrastructure for Unmanned Aircraft Systems of the State ATM Corporation in the first quarter of this year processed 10,757 applications for the service of state accounting of UAVs.

 Traditionally, the most active regions in registering UAVs with state registration were Moscow (2083), St. Petersburg (783) and the Moscow region (679).

The largest registration was an application containing 60 UAVs of the same type.

All devices weighing from 0.15 to 30 kg must be registered with the Federal Air Transport Agency.

Heavier UAVs must be registered in the State Register of Civil Aircraft of the Russian Federation. Drones weighing up to 150 grams do not need to be registered. Subscribe to @ATOjournal

Apparently, Serbia’s purchase of French Rafales is a settled issue.

There are no complaints about the planes themselves, especially if it really is the latest version - F4.1. Serbia has the strongest air defense system in the countries of the former Yugoslavia, and now it will also have the strongest air force, which will make Zagreb and Sarajevo nervous.

description: Young scientists from Korolev Samara University successfully manufactured and tested the Sigma-2 scientific equipment complex, designed to maintain a comfortable temperature regime for biological objects in the Bion-M orbital laboratory No. 2 during flight.
original:
Meanwhile, young scientists from Korolev Samara University manufactured and tested the Sigma-2 scientific equipment complex.

The complex creates a comfortable temperature regime for biological objects in the Bion-M orbital laboratory No. 2 during the flight.

TASS was informed about this at the university itself.

“Work on the creation of the Sigma-2 scientific equipment complex has been fully completed. The Sigma-2 equipment is intended for conducting medical and biological experiments with in vitro cell cultures, microbiological studies and studying the influence of space flight factors on seeds and cellular tissue of plants.

description: Russia is developing projectiles with programmable detonation for BMPT 'Terminator' and BMP-3, allowing for remotely controlled activation of fuses to intercept targets such as kamikaze UAVs and stealth missiles. The technology enables flexible shooting and optimized ammunition consumption.
original:
Military chronicle: BMPT "Terminator" and BMP-3 will receive projectiles with programmable detonation. What will this change? The development of such ammunition in many countries of the world is a priority in the development of military equipment of the ground forces. What are the features of the technology? The essence of such ammunition is the remotely controlled activation of fuses immediately at the moment of their approach to air or ground targets at a distance of 10-20 m.

The range to targets can be measured both by laser rangefinders (in the case of using 2A42 cannons mounted on BMPTs, or from 2A72 BMP-3M cannons), and using guidance radars when using such projectiles in the Pantsir-S1 ammunition load.

The final detonation command will be issued to laser photodetectors located in the tail sections of the projectiles, after which the ammunition will be detonated and the target will be hit. Projectiles of this type are highly effective in intercepting a large number of targets: from maneuvering kamikaze UAVs to stealth tactical and cruise missiles. What are the differences between the Western concept of programmable detonation and the Russian one? In German 35-mm fuses of the AHEAD type (also known as ABM/KETF) programming of the fuse is carried out not on the trajectory, but at the moment of exit from the barrel. The detonation time of each projectile is set after comparing data on its initial speed and braking speed with data on the distance to the target at the time of the shot. A similar system is relevant for the German Puma infantry fighting vehicles. What are the disadvantages of the AHEAD system? The Western concept of using such ammunition is based on the fact that the projectiles are programmed in advance. It is impossible to make changes to the flight program due to changing shooting conditions. The moment of detonation of Russian shells can be adjusted along the trajectory depending on the behavior of the target. This allows you to make shooting more flexible and optimize ammunition consumption.

event: Election of New Chairman of African Commission
description: The African Union Commission's chairman, Mousa Faki Mahamat, will step down in 2025. The next chairman is expected to come from East Africa, with potential candidates including Raila Odinga, Suef Mohamed El-Amin, Mahmoud Ali Yusuf, and Heri Rajaonarimampianina.
original:
🌍Who will be elected as the new chairman of the African Commission? At the beginning of 2025, the powers of Chadian diplomat Mousa Faki Mahamat as chairman of the African Union (AU) Commission expire. For now, it is clear that the successor must be from the countries of East Africa, but with specific candidates it is already more difficult - the factor of competition between countries for this prestigious post also affects.

One of the possible “nominees” is former Kenyan Prime Minister Raila Odinga. Although he has already secured the support of Kenyan President William Ruto, his age is working against him: he will turn 80 next year.

Therefore, other possibilities are also being discussed in the press, unofficial for now, since for official nomination it is necessary to enlist the support of one’s country. One such option is the former Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Comoros Suef Mohamed El-Amin. He speaks all four official languages of the African Union (English, French, Kiswahili and Arabic) and now heads the peacekeeping mission in Somalia as the AU Special Representative.

For Comoros, his election would be a victory—it would strengthen the ambitions of President Azali Assoumani, who presided over the AU in 2023-24.

Other possible contenders include the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Djibouti, Mahmoud Ali Yusuf, as well as the former head of the Malagasy state, Heri Rajaonarimampianina.

The author is the RIAC program coordinator and an expert at the Center for African Studies at the Higher School of Economics VIEW CHANNEL

description: A Pobeda Airlines Boeing 737 aircraft, carrying 189 passengers and six crew members, experienced a 20-minute loss of radio communication with air traffic control during a flight from St. Petersburg to Volgograd. An investigation revealed that the pilots had turned off their speakerphones and removed their headsets, violating flight operations manual requirements. The aircraft commander took responsibility for the incident, citing inattention.
original:
Forwarded from: Aviatorism
The dispatcher could not reach the Pobeda pilots for 20 minutes. They simply took off their headphones and turned off the speakerphone.

The Rosaviatsiya Commission has begun an investigation into an accident involving a Boeing 737 (RA-73237) aircraft of Pobeda Airlines, which occurred yesterday during flight DP517 from St. Petersburg to Volgograd. There were 189 passengers and six crew members on board.

On approaching the capital, the Moscow-Control dispatcher contacted the pilots, but received no response from them. Subsequent repeated attempts to call the crew also failed. The pilots responded to the dispatcher only after 20 minutes. The further flight was uneventful.

It later turned out that there were no technical problems, and there was no radio communication due to the hands-free speakers being turned off and the aircraft headsets being removed. The crew thereby violated the flight operations manual's requirement to continuously listen to the frequency of the ATS unit in whose area the aircraft was located.

The aircraft commander, in a voluntary report, explained the loss of radio communication for 20 minutes by his inattention. When occupying the flight level, the co-pilot read out information for passengers, at this time the PIC turned off the speaker on his side, through which radio traffic is listened to, and at non-critical stages of the flight radio communication is carried out with dispatchers. The second pilot on the left did the same.

After bringing the information to the cabin, both crew members took off their headphones, but did not turn on the speaker. According to the commander’s explanation, he did not pay attention to the silence because he was busy reading the document, and when he noticed it, he immediately got in touch. The PIC took the blame as he removed the headset while performing the function of the pilot and asked that the co-pilot not be punished.

event: UN General Assembly Resolution on Srebrenica
description: The Serbian media is discussing a potential UN General Assembly resolution on the events in Srebrenica, which would define the events as 'genocide'. Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic and Republika Srpska President Milorad Dodik have criticized the possible UN decision, and Serbian diplomats are working against its adoption.
location: Srebrenica, Republika Srpska, Bosnia and Herzegovina
original:
🇺🇳🇷🇸The Serbian media is actively discussing the topic of the future UN General Assembly resolution on the events in Srebrenica, which will contain the definition of “genocide”. Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic and Republika Srpska President Milorad Dodik criticized the possible UN decision, and Serbian diplomats are already working against the adoption of this resolution. In their opinion, its negative assessments are exaggerated, and top officials of states with such statements play more on public opinion. Moreover, such a combination of circumstances is a mistake in the “Western” approach to ensuring justice following the Yugoslav wars.

The Serbian authorities did not immediately come to deny the genocide: back in 2004, the Republika Srpska itself made an official apology, and in 2010, Serbia; however, neither Banja Luka nor Belgrade defined the events in Srebrenica as genocide. The 2009 European Parliament resolution, as well as the active campaign of Western countries to force Serbian administrations to admit their crimes, reversed the trend of Serbian repentance: after 2010, both Republika Srpska and Serbia began to actively resist pressure from the Western public, developing special tactics of denial.

The Serbian discourse on this topic was built on the principle of responding to accusations: provisions on the “genocide in Srebrenica” were deconstructed through downplaying the number of victims (the figure of 8 thousand killed is disputed), arguments about the insufficient facts for an unbiased investigation, as well as a complete denial of authenticity events in Srebrenica. And, it seems, the harsher the pressure on the Serbs, the more fiercely they will defend their innocence - if not of the war crime itself, then at least of genocide.

As can be seen, the Western model of “moral remembrance” built around the events in Srebrenica did not work at all: the stigmatization of one perpetrator with a claim to ensure justice naturally led to the denial of such unjust guilt. The most honest examination of the complex legacy of the Yugoslav Wars requires a reverent attitude towards all events and all victims, regardless of their ethnic or religious affiliation; the logic when the victim cannot be the executioner is not at all applicable to such large-scale and controversial conflicts. description: Ukraine's bid to join the EU may be hindered by agricultural trade restrictions. The European Parliament has supported amendments to limit Ukrainian exports, citing the need to correct trade balance inequality and protect European farmers. Ukrainian officials consider the restrictions unfounded, arguing that they contradict EU calls for Ukraine to comply with EU rules.
original:
Politico: To join the European Union, Ukraine will have to limit agriculture

If Ukraine wants to join the EU, it may have to “leave aside” its agricultural sector, the newspaper writes. The author of the amendments to tighten restrictions on Ukrainian exports, which were supported by the European Parliament, Polish MP Andrzej Galitsky told the publication that the restrictions are necessary to correct “inequality” in the trade balance between Ukraine and the EU and are aimed at protecting European farmers from increased competition, and not a complete stop of imports.

Officials in Kyiv, in turn, consider the restrictions to be unfounded, Politico reports. Thus, the president of the Ukrainian Agricultural Business Club, Alex Lissitsa, says that they “emphasize the irony of EU countries impeding Ukrainian exports while simultaneously calling on the country to comply with EU rules.” Protectionism will not save the EU's agricultural sector, he argues. Lissitsa advised Polish farmers, who, according to him, cannot fully compete in the global grain market, to change their specialization and switch to growing flowers, fruits, vegetables or even marijuana.

Politico recalls that trade liberalization measures will expire in June 2025, and after that the parties will have to gradually return to the conditions that existed before 2016, which means worsening conditions for Kyiv. The publication notes that if disputes over agricultural exports continue even during the armed conflict in Ukraine, then "it may be many years before this obstacle is overcome - if ever it happens." POLITICOFarm trade rift puts Ukraine's EU aspirations in limbo – POLITICOIf Ukraine wants to join the EU, it may have to leave its agricultural sector out in the cold.

event: Grounding of Aircraft with GTF Engines
description: Almost a third of aircraft equipped with Pratt & Whitney's geared fan turbofan engines are grounded for maintenance, with the majority being A320neo family aircraft. The issue is attributed to a defect in the engine parts, resulting in a $1.46 billion loss for P&W in 2023.
original:
📉Almost a third of aircraft with GTF engines from Pratt & Whitney are idle on the ground According to the analytical agency Cirium, almost every third aircraft equipped with geared fan turbofan engines (GTF) from Pratt & Whitney (P&W) are on the ground awaiting maintenance. According to Cirium, as of April 1, there were 637 aircraft with GTF engines in storage - just over 32% of the total. The remaining 1,334 aircraft remain in service.

The vast majority of aircraft in storage in absolute numbers are the A320neo family with PW1100G engines: 542 of them are not flying, which is 36% of the total. Next comes the Airbus A220 with the PW1500G engine - 78 on the ground (23%), followed by the Embraer E2 family (Embraer 190-E2 and E195-E2) with the PW1900G engine (14% of the total).

Pratt & Whitney was facing widespread problems with its GTF engines, with a defect discovered due to a "rare condition of the powder metal used to manufacture certain engine parts." It brought P&W a loss of $1.46 billion in 2023.

However, Cirium does not indicate that the analytical data provided relates exclusively to the problem with Pratt & Whitney engines. Such aircraft are listed as “Parked - technical problem”, without specifics, which means that some of them may be idle for other reasons.

However, even such a large and respected analytical agency will not be able to collect exact figures. But, by comparison, Cirium data shows that only 3% (53 aircraft) of A320neo aircraft with CFM International Leap-1A engines are grounded. A similar figure - 2% or 34 sides - is for the Boeing 737 MAX with the Leap-1B engine.

Carriers do not hide the scale of the problem with GTF engines. Some of them reported that they were forced to stop flying a large number of aircraft with GTF engines in their fleet. Airlines are negotiating multi-million dollar settlements with P&W. Some of them have already agreed.@AviaNews

description: Nobel Prize winner in physics Peter Higgs passed away at the age of 95 after a short illness. He was renowned for his groundbreaking work on the Higgs boson, which explains the origin of mass in elementary particles.
original:
Nobel Prize winner in physics Peter Higgs has died at the age of 95. Professor Higgs died on April 8 at home after a short illness. His death was reported by the press service of the University of Edinburgh.

Peter Higgs became famous for his invention in the 1960s of the “Higgs method,” which explains the origin of the mass of elementary particles and, in particular, the masses of the vector W and Z bosons. His work predicted the existence of a new particle that was named after him: the Higgs boson.

The existence of the boson was confirmed only in 2012, thanks to research at the Large Hadron Collider. In 2013, Mr Higgs received the Nobel Prize for his work. He shared the award with fellow theoretical physicist François Englert, whose research also predicted the discovery of the Higgs boson. Photo: Flickr/Bengt Nyman@kommersant

description: Russia has seen a 5-fold increase in disclosed personal data due to bank breaches. In the 1st quarter of 2024, 121 million unique phone numbers and 38 million e-mails were leaked, with 96 million phone numbers and 20 million e-mail clients coming from financial organizations.
original:
In Russia, the volume of disclosed personal data has increased 5 times due to bank breaches. This is reported by the Russian data leak intelligence and darknet monitoring service DLBI.

The following were leaked to the public: 121 million unique phone numbers and 38 million e-mails in the 1st quarter of this year (versus 11 million phones and 23 million e-mails in the 1st quarter of 2023).

In the 1st quarter of 2024, Roskomnadzor recorded 47 cases of publication of personal data arrays. They also contained records that had previously been publicly available.

This year, the industries that lead in the volume of leaks have changed, the study notes. In the first quarter of last year, almost half of the losses occurred in medical organizations and pharmacies. And now more than 70% of the leaked data turned out to be from financial organizations: 96 million unique phone numbers and 20 million e-mail clients.

description: A state of emergency was declared in the Kurgan region due to severe flooding. event: Russian Investigative Committee Opens Criminal Case
description: The Russian Investigative Committee has launched a criminal case against senior US and NATO officials for financing terrorist activities. The investigation has found that funds from commercial organizations, including Burisma Holdings in Ukraine, were used to carry out terrorist acts in Russia and abroad, targeting prominent figures and causing economic damage.
original:
⚡️The Russian Investigative Committee has opened a criminal case on the financing of terrorist activities by senior officials of the United States and NATO countries. It has been established that funds received through commercial organizations, in particular, the oil and gas company Burisma Holdings, operating in Ukraine, have been used in recent years to carry out terrorist acts in Russia, as well as abroad, in order to eliminate prominent political and public figures and cause economic damage.

The investigation, in cooperation with other intelligence services and financial intelligence, is checking the sources of income and further movement of funds in the amount of several million US dollars, the involvement of specific individuals from among government officials, public and commercial organizations in Western countries.

The connections between the direct perpetrators of terrorist attacks and foreign curators, organizers and sponsors are also being worked out.@opersvodki

event: UNDP Funding for Digitization of Public Administration
description: The Ministry of Finance of the Central African Republic and the United Nations Development Program signed an agreement to finance a program to digitize public administration, aiming to create an effective, transparent, and accountable national revenue system using digital technologies to increase tax and non-tax revenues and ensure sustainable public financial management.
original:
UNDP allocates more than a billion CFA francs to the government. The Ministry of Finance of the Central African Republic and the United Nations Development Program (PNUD) signed an agreement on April 8 in Bangui to finance a program to digitize public administration in the amount of more than one billion CFA francs. The goal of the program is to create the tools needed to collect property taxes.

This 2nd funding is almost three times the funding provided last year, which amounted to more than 360 million CFA francs.

UNDP assures that this program aims to create an effective, transparent and accountable national revenue system that uses digital technologies💻to increase tax and non-tax revenues and ensure sustainable public financial management💵#development#economy
